content.question: A car is moving with constant speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> when a tree falls into the roadway at <math alttext="lowercase t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. It takes the driver a time <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>T</mi></math> to react and apply the brakes. The car then slows with a constant acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>. Which of the following equations correctly expresses the distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> traveled by the car from time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to the instant the car comes to rest?
